children.value: The purpose of this list is to help in finding the methods when working with PSR-7. This can be considered as a cheatsheet for PSR-7 interfaces.
The interfaces defined in PSR-7 are the following:
Representation of an outgoing, client-side request.
Representation of an incoming, server-side HTTP request.
Representation of an outgoing, server-side response.
Value object representing a file uploaded through an HTTP request.
Returns new message instance with given HTTP protocol version
Checks if HTTP Header with given name exists
Retrieves a array with the values for a single header
Retrieves a comma-separated string of the values for a single header
Returns new message instance with given HTTP Header
if the header existed in the original instance, replaces the header value from the original message with the value provided when creating the new instance.
Returns new message instance with appended value to given header
If header already exists value will be appended, if not a new header will be created
Removes HTTP Header with given name
Returns new message instance with given HTTP Message Body
Return a new message instance with the specific request-target
Retrieves the HTTP method of the request.
GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, DELETE, CONNECT, OPTIONS, TRACE (defined in
Returns a new message instance with the provided HTTP method
Returns a new message instance with the provided URI
Retrieves cookies sent by the client to the server.
Returns a new request instance with the specified cookies
Returns a new request instance with the specified query string arguments
Returns a new request instance with the specified uploaded files
Retrieve any parameters provided in the request body
Returns a new request instance with the specified body parameters
Retrieve attributes derived from the request
Retrieve a single derived request attribute
Returns a new request instance with the specified derived request attribute
Returns a new request instance that without the specified derived request attribute
Returns a new response instance with the specified status code and, optionally, reason phrase.
Gets the response reason phrase associated with the status code.
Reads all data from the stream into a string, from the beginning to end.
Closes the stream and any underlying resources.
Separates any underlying resources from the stream.
Get the size of the stream if known.
Returns true if the stream is at the end of the stream.
Returns whether or not the stream is seekable.
Seek to a position in the stream.
Seek to the beginning of the stream.
Returns whether or not the stream is writable.
Returns whether or not the stream is readable.
Returns the remaining contents in a string
Get stream metadata as an associative array or retrieve a specific key.
Retrieve the scheme component of the URI.
Retrieve the authority component of the URI.
Retrieve the user information component of the URI.
Retrieve the host component of the URI.
Retrieve the port component of the URI.
Retrieve the path component of the URI.
Retrieve the query string of the URI.
Retrieve the fragment component of the URI.
Return an instance with the specified scheme.
Return an instance with the specified user information.
Return an instance with the specified host.
Return an instance with the specified port.
Return an instance with the specified path.
Return an instance with the specified query string.
Return an instance with the specified URI fragment.
Return the string representation as a URI reference.
Retrieve a stream representing the uploaded file.
Move the uploaded file to a new location.
Retrieve the error associated with the uploaded file.
Retrieve the filename sent by the client.
Retrieve the media type sent by the client.
